section.title: Modules and Tools
section.para: Modules are responsible for most of the Gwyddion features. They mostly include data processing functions as leveling, rotations, integral transforms, etc. See Data process menu for list of available modules.

Tools are a special kind of modules that work directly on data windows. They are used for interactive selection of areas, lines or other types of objects on the data and processing them. Tools can be launched only from tools button rows located in the main window. Gwyddion includes these tools:

listitem.para: Read value under cursor – reads x,y,z values at the position of mouse click. You can average more points around the point where you clicked.
Measure distances – similarly to Read value tool enables user to read distance and angle between points in the data field.

Fit X/Y profiles by polynomial – very frequently used tool for basic processing of raw SPM data. Profiles taken in the fast scanning axis (usually X-axis) can be mutually shifted by some amount or having slightly different slope. Fit X/Y profiles tool can fix this discrepancy.
Crop – cuts part of the data and puts it to new window.
Three-point leveling – levels data by plane obtained by clicking on three points within data window.
Statistical quantities – computes basic statistical quantities (RMS, Ra, etc.) from selection of full data field.
Statistical functions – computes basic statistical functions (distribution of heights, autocorrelation function, etc.) from selection of full data field.
Profile extraction – extracts profiles of the data field and puts them to separate graphs. These graphs can be further processed with commands from the Graph menu.
Basic filters – mean, median, conservative denoise and similar simple filters to reduce noise in the data.
Manually remove grains – remove continuous parts of the mask by clicking on mask point.
Manually remove spots – draw rectangle around defect in AFM data image and remove the defect using chosen interpolation method.
Stretch color range – enables user to change the false color representation range (by default from data minimum to data maximum).
Mask editor – manual editing of masks: creation, exclusion, intersection, inversion, growing and shrinking, …

section.para: Tool dialogs can be closed (or more precisely hidden, as the current tool is still active even if its dialog is not visible), beside activating the Hide button, by pressing Esc or clicking the tool's button in the toolbox again.
